item.title: The Federal Home Guarantee Scheme is expanding, but just how many will be able to afford to buy in?
item.description: The expansion of the scheme, which allows first home buyers to purchase a property with as little as a 5 per cent deposit, has some warning it will also inflate the market. Here's what you'll need to be earning to get a foot in the door.

item.title: SA's ongoing harmful algal bloom labelled 'cultural emergency' by First Nations groups
item.description: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

item.title: Children are being 'poisoned' by high lead levels as state government agency is accused of report cover-up
item.description: A state government body sat on a report into lead dust that was "poisoning" children for nearly four years and tried to keep its release quiet.

item.title: Cashrewards's abrupt closure leaves shoppers many unanswered questions. Here's what we know
item.description: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

item.title: NT DPP considering appeal of 'callous' fatal hit-run driver's home detention
item.description: The Northern Territory's Director of Public Prosecutions is considering whether to appeal a decision to allow a young fatal hit-and-run driver who bragged to his friends afterwards to avoid jail time.

item.title: Sam Konstas scores Australia A century in four-day game in India
item.description: Sam Konstas's push for an Ashes spot continues as he clatters a century in an extended session for Australia A in Lucknow.

item.title: WA Police officers subject to restraining orders desk-bound under gun reforms, union says
item.description: New firearms laws meaning WA Police officers can't carry a gun if they're subject to a restraining order are leaving them desk-bound, their union warns.

item.title: Firefighters honoured for Black Summer efforts as CFA warns about fire season
item.description: Firefighters say they learnt a lot from the Black Summer bushfires, but fear Victorians have become complacent in preparations ahead of this fire season.

item.title: Khapra beetle, a threat to grains industry, discovered in imported nappy pants
item.description: Authorities are investigating how khapra beetle, the number-one-priority pest for the grains industry, entered Australia.

item.title: Warnings of flash flooding after torrential rain drenches Far North Queensland
item.description: Huge rainfall totals of more than 300 millimetres have taken even rain-hardened Far North Queenslanders by surprise at a typically drier time of the year.

item.title: Why 'everything feels easier' for Chloe Rykers since her breast reduction
item.description: Chloe Rykers says her "big boobs" had, in various ways, made her career harder and left her feeling uncomfortable and in pain.

item.title: Jimmy Barnes, Dave Faulkner among music industry voices in open letter urging ANU to keep School of Music
item.description: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

item.title: Panthers reflect on how Knights loss fuelled run to NRL semifinals
item.description: The Panthers were last on the ladder after round 12, but a "brutal reality check" helped fuel the four-time defending premier's run to this season's finals series.

item.title: Does the damning planning report mean the end for Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium?
item.description: The Tasmanian Planning Commission described the Hobart stadium as a "singular, large, bulky monolith" with "optimism bias" in the government's cost-benefit figures. What does this mean for the stadium?

item.title: Toucans and other exotic animals rescued in major Brazilian trafficking bust
item.description: Brazilian authorities say they have disrupted a major animal trafficking ring, rescuing hundreds of exotic animals and making dozens of arrests.

item.title: Albanese has found out nailing down Pacific agreements is harder than expected
item.description: Anthony Albanese was meant to emerge from his recent flurry of Pacific diplomacy holding no fewer than two major agreements — instead he's returning home conspicuously empty-handed.

item.title: In Donald Trump's America, questions not to the president's liking are met with hostility
item.description: As America enters a dark tunnel of dangerous internal divisions and an increasingly violent public discourse, Donald Trump is escalating his attacks on many of this nation's institutions.

item.title: Man charged with murder after bones found in search for Susan Goodwin
item.description: Bones have been found at a Port Lincoln property in the search for the remains of Susan Goodwin, who went missing in Port Lincoln decades ago.

item.title: Australia refusing to panic over Pat Cummins's injury ahead of Ashes
item.description: Australia coach Andrew McDonald is confident injured captain Pat Cummins will be fit to play a major role in the men's Ashes, even if he does not feature in all five matches of the series.

item.description: Prominent left-wing commentator Hasan Piker opens up to 7.30 on Donald Trump's left-wing crackdown, the Charlie Kirk he knew and attempts to have him deplatformed.

item.title: Why rower Jean Mitchell got an Olympic rings tattoo over her chemo scar
item.description: Making it to the Paris 2024 Olympics was a career highlight for Jean Mitchell — and the brain cancer survivor marked the achievement in a special way.

item.title: Coal miner Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane, Bowen Basin
item.description: Mining giant Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane and the Bowen Basin in the wake of BHP Mitsubishi Alliance axing 750 workers.

item.title: Northern WA communities already adapting to extreme climate future
item.description: Locals in small northern WA communities say the potential dangers identified by the Climate Risk Assessment are already starting to appear.

item.title: The Sydneysiders saving thousands by leaving the city on 'financial gap year'
item.description: As Sydneysiders struggle with the soaring cost of living, a teacher has found financial freedom thousands of kilometres away, while a digital marketer swaps the city for the bush to save up $100,000.

item.title: Gaming history goes on display with Australian titles Hollow Knight Silksong and Team Fortress chronicled
item.description: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

item.title: Cairns alleged shooter John Willey charged after central Queensland manhunt
item.description: John Durham Willey has been taken into custody, accused of shooting a man in the leg at a Cairns hotel.

item.title: Australia loses second ODI to India by record runs margin ahead of Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: A 102-run thumping, the biggest loss by runs for Australia's women's team, sets up a thrilling ODI series decider in India ahead of the Cricket World Cup.

item.title: Cairns maternity ward named as exposure site in Far North Queensland measles outbreak
item.description: More locally acquired cases have been confirmed with exposure sites now including Cairns Hospital's maternity ward and areas on the Atherton Tablelands.

item.title: Two men charged with murder of Kwar Ater after Melbourne CBD drive-by shooting
item.description: The charges follow the death of a 26-year-old Seabrook man, Kwar Ater, on Elizabeth Street earlier this month.

item.title: Kmart broke privacy laws by using facial recognition technology, commissioner finds
item.description: The privacy commissioner has found Kmart broke the Privacy Act with its use of facial recognition technology, ordering the retail giant not to repeat the practice.

item.title: Broken Hill launches LGBTQIA+ festival Rainbow in the Outback
item.description: The outback city of Broken Hill is no stranger to celebrating the LGBTQIA+ community, with a new festival focusing on diversity and inclusion launching last weekend.

item.title: Patient 'devastated' as Sydney's dedicated long COVID clinic to close
item.description: A patient of NSW's first dedicated long COVID clinic in Sydney says she is "devastated" and "bewildered" that it will close at the end of the month.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Live pulled from air by US broadcaster ABC over 'insensitive' Charlie Kirk comments
item.description: The late-night talk show's host suggested during a monologue earlier this week that Charlie Kirk's alleged killer may have been a pro-Trump Republican.

item.title: Gardeners share the joys of turning dust to daisies in the Australian outback
item.description: Flower farmer Suzanne Stanton says generations of outback women have taken comfort in their gardens, proof that life can survive in the harshest of climates.

item.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect Tyler Robinson surrendered in fear of being shot by police, sheriff says
item.description: Tyler Robinson, the Utah man accused of killing political activist Charlie Kirk, only agreed to surrender if it was done peacefully, a sheriff involved with his arrest says.

item.title: Palliative Care Australia art prize inspires conversations about death and grieving
item.description: In its fifth year, Palliative Care Australia's Live Well, Die Well national art prize continues to spark important conversations about dying.

item.title: South Sydney Rabbitohs player Brandon Smith faces court on drug, betting charges
item.description: South Sydney Rabbitohs player Brandon Smith has appeared in a Gold Coast court to face drug supply and illegal betting charges.

item.title: Man sets out to combat 'isolating experience' of spinal cord injury
item.description: David Ham says the reality of his spinal cord injury hit him when he returned home from hospital and had no-one to talk to with a similar experience.

item.title: How the Collingwood Magpies are righting the ship this AFLW season
item.description: A year after finishing dead last in the AFLW, the Magpies have started making moves up the ladder thanks to a new approach at both ends of the field.

item.title: Australian cow market at record high as US demand hits 'scary times'
item.description: Australian cow prices are at record highs, but are still way below the United States where beef demand is going "crazy".

item.title: Mal Lanyon addresses NYE controversy as race for top NSW Police job continues
item.description: Mal Lanyon — who is vying to become the next police commissioner — conceded he should have thought "more carefully" about taking his wife and two friends onboard a police boat on Sydney Harbour on New Year's Eve in 2023.

item.title: Female pedestrian dies after being hit by truck in Melbourne's north
item.description: Emergency crews treated the woman at the scene, but she could not be revived.

item.title: The AFL is in danger of becoming a 'two-tier competition' as multiple club captains search for the exit door
item.description: Three captains from the AFL's four worst-performing clubs are searching for the exit door. It is the symptom of a player movement era that has left the gap between the AFL's strongest and weakest larger than ever.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate targets on path to net zero judged by the experts
item.description: After much anticipation, Australia has its new climate targets. Now that the dice have fallen, we consult experts on their assessment of how these targets stack up with what’s at stake.

item.title: Disability employment provider Bedford's financial situation concerns SA, federal government
item.description: The federal disability minister says his concerns about Australia's second-largest disability employment provider, Bedford, have grown.

item.title: Family of Aboriginal man killed in Darwin hit-and-run speak out over driver's sentence
item.description: The family of an Aboriginal man killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out about the sentence handed to the man who killed him, and the "racist, dehumanising" messages he sent afterwards.

item.title: Albanese to meet with Trump after returning from Pacific empty-handed
item.description: This week in politics, the prime minister returned home from the Pacific empty-handed and the climate debate continued to unsettle the Coalition.

item.title: National Gathering backs plans for new First Nations body, but tensions remain
item.description: First Nations leaders have endorsed plans for a new national representative body to be established. Here’s what we know.

item.title: Albury Wodonga Regional Cancer Centre to become public hospital
item.description: A major cancer centre on the Victorian-New South Wales border will become a fully public hospital in a move that has caught a healthcare provider by surprise and sparked community concern.

item.title: WA coal phase-out uncertainty amid Bluewaters power station closure backflip
item.description: Efforts by WA's government to force the premature closure of a privately owned coal plant appear to be unravelling after the market operator backed the power station to keep running towards the end of the decade.

item.title: Henley residents advised to keep windows, doors closed amid algal bloom crisis
item.description: Authorities have told a group of residents living near a metropolitan Adelaide beach to close their doors and windows to prevent symptoms related to South Australia's ongoing algal bloom.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel is the latest to be put on pause. How Trump is influencing the world of late-night TV
item.description: Emmys watchers could assume there's never been a better time in Hollywood to hold its most powerful to account, but Jimmy Kimmel's axing proves otherwise.

item.title: Bindi Magic art exhibition opens in Alice Springs as organisation celebrates 25 years
item.description: For 25 years Bindi Mwerre Anthurre Artists has been helping people with a disability to communicate through creativity.

item.description: A New South Wales police officer is found not guilty of using unreasonable force while removing three girls and a woman from a scuffle at a shopping centre.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Trump says Jimmy Kimmel off-air for 'bad ratings' as Democrats slam regulator for 'bullying' US ABC
item.description: Prominent leaders in the Democratic Party are accusing the US's communications regulator of "bullying" a network to take the long-running late night show off air.

item.title: Independent advice spells out mammoth task ahead for government to reach 2035 target
item.description: Getting to even the bottom end of the government's 62 to 70 per cent emissions reduction target by 2035 will require drastic increases to solar and wind power capacity, electric vehicle take-up and an extension of the safeguard mechanism, according to the Climate Change Authority.

item.title: The climate conversation is stuck in a loop, but out in the world things are changing
item.description: We don't have to wait for moonshot technologies to reach our climate targets. Most of the solutions to the climate crisis are already around us.

item.title: First Guardian, Shield superannuation disasters expose deep flaws in Australia's $4.3 trillion retirement system
item.description: The failed First Guardian and Shield schemes have cost about 12,000 Australians more than $1 billion in retirement savings and exposed deep flaws in how Australia's $4.3 trillion superannuation sector is regulated.

item.title: Therapists, patients raise concerns over The Hobart Clinic closure with fears it could be 'dangerous' for some
item.description: For more than four decades, The Hobart Clinic has provided private mental health services to clients. Since the announcement of its October closure, clinic staff, therapists and patients have warned of the negative impact on those reliant on the service.

item.title: Gout Gout's understanding of patience shows World Athletics Championships performance in 200m semifinal won't be one off
item.description: Gout Gout's promise and progress are on full display at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by showing patience, he could get even better.

item.title: New Huon Aquaculture head Charles von der Heyde says salmon review followed spread of 'gossip'
item.description: Huon Aquaculture's new chief executive officer has described the upcoming review of Tasmania's salmon industry as "unnecessary", saying that a pause on expansion would not stop the company's plans.

item.title: Home owners warned to consider 'liveability' of properties amid climate change impact warning
item.description: Property experts say a "dizzying" report forecasting the impacts of worsening climate conditions on Australian properties has sounded a clear warning for the sector.

item.title: Parents call for football club culture change after death of 21-year-old son
item.description: Steven Callanan had the world at his feet and loved footy like it was a religion. The talented player could bring together communities while he played, but after a night of partying he took his own life.

item.title: Drug checking services handed bitter pill as Queensland government rams through law changes
item.description: The Queensland government has been unrepentant in its tough stance on drugs, with Health Minister Tim Nicholls telling state parliament this week it doesn't "support drug dealers", writes Janelle Miles.

item.description: Visitors flocking to Queensland's Darling Downs for the annual Carnival of Flowers in Toowoomba are advised to take an umbrella, with thunderstorms forecast for the region.

item.description: The Australian share market gained, after Wall Street's S&P 500 hit a record high, and the Bank of Japan kept its policy rate steady at 0.5 per cent.

item.description: It's been two days since three people died after a devastating Optus outage caused hundreds of emergency calls to fail, but information about the incident remains scarce.

item.description: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

item.title: Investigation of eye-maker's online presence reveals multiple red flags

item.title: Technology is driving a quiet revolution in the way players relate to golf
item.description: Virtual golf venues are popping up en masse, as the sport adapts to suit the players of a new era.

item.title: Collingwood and Brisbane meet again, two years on from classic 2023 grand final, for tantalising rematch

item.title: Federal government's agriculture emissions reductions 'ambitious' but 'achievable'
item.description: A professor of carbon farming says the agriculture industry will "naturally" contribute to a 28 per cent emissions reduction projected by 2050, but is unlikely to hit its own net-zero targets.

item.title: Pink Floyd's album and ode to Syd Barrett Wish You Were Here turns 50
item.description: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

item.title: Freezing rain or 12,000km away, these green Vikings will do anything for their beloved Canberra Raiders
item.description: Simon Tayoun's been a devout member of the Green Army since he watched his first-ever game of rugby league in 1987, and now he's become an unofficial mascot by bringing his custom drum to every game he can to lead the Viking Clap.

item.description: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

item.description: Sam Kerr is honoured with a special football to mark her 100 goals for Chelsea — and she can't stop smiling since the landmark strike.

item.description: Half a century after the Kianga mine explosion killed 13 workers in central Queensland, a community gathers to remember the tragedy as survivors and experts raise fresh concerns about ongoing safety risks.

item.description: A changing of the guard in women's rugby union as two-time defending world champions New Zealand is beaten for the first time at the tournament since 2014 by a brilliant Canadian side.

item.description: Apiarists are concerned they are losing access to public land in Victoria that provides a critical food source for their hives.

item.description: This is the third fatal strike the US military has carried out this month on a vessel allegedly carrying drugs.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: World-first turtle tracking reveals secrets of flatback turtles in WA's Roebuck Bay
item.description: GPS tracking, motion sensors and video cameras reveal where flatback turtles in Broome's Roebuck Bay feed and travel, contributing to a richer understanding of the vulnerable species.

item.title: Optus admits it had early warning about triple-0 failure as fourth death investigated
item.description: Optus reveals it received an early warning of Thursday's system failure — which has since been linked to a fourth death — hours before the situation was fixed, but that it did not respond appropriately to complaints from concerned customers.

item.title: Freezing rain or 12,000km away, these green Vikings will do anything for their beloved Canberra Raiders
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Canberra Raiders receive NRL semifinal blow, losing five-eighth Ethan Strange to illness
item.description: Canberra Raiders are forced to reshuffle their team on the morning of the semifinal against Cronulla after illness struck wunderkind Ethan Strange.

item.title: Critical incident declared after man dies during alleged DV arrest in Sydney's south west
item.description: Police were called to two separate domestic-related incidents in New South Wales overnight.

item.title: UN says there's evidence organised crime scam centres are moving from South-East Asia into new frontier of the Pacific
item.description: As scam centres run by organised crime find it harder to operate in South-East Asia, evidence emerges of them moving into the Pacific and setting up lucrative operations estimated to net billions each year.

item.title: Transition from sheep to cropping in WA's Avon Valley leaving limited balloon landing sites
item.description: The move out of sheep by an increasing number of WA farmers is having an unexpected impact on the state's hot air balloon pilots.

item.title: WA Premier Roger Cook says fourth possible death linked to Optus outage
item.description: WA Police have referred the death of a second West Australian on Thursday during an Optus outage for investigation by the state's coroner, bringing the total number of deaths linked to the incident to four.

item.title: Amina Al-Mufti was fetching water when she was killed by a missile strike.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: From Jennifer Lopez to K-pop, meet the Australian backing artists helping superstars shine
item.description: Backup dancers and backing singers spend years perfecting their craft. But who are these artists and how does it feel performing in the shadows of superstars?

item.title: Experts weigh in on how to end WA's housing crisis
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Minister slams 'extremist' candidates nominating for WA council elections
item.description: Local Government Minister Hannah Beazely condemns the emergence of "extremist" candidates nominating for the state's forthcoming council elections.

item.title: Trump will impose a $150,000 annual fee for H-1B visas. Here's what it means
item.description: Some hope this visa price hike will see the US tech industry prioritise American workers. Others argue it'll dissuade the "world's smartest talent" from choosing to work in the US.

item.title: Kangaroos beat Blues for 18th straight AFLW win as Cats, Hawks and Dockers triumph
item.description: Reigning premiers North Melbourne thrashes Carlton by 53 points, while Port Adelaide is stunned by an umpiring decision in its narrow loss to Geelong.

item.title: Crowds flock to Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers despite wet weather
item.description: Cold and damp conditions have not been enough to keep people away from Toowoomba's annual floral extravaganza.

item.title: Brisbane defeats Collingwood by 29 points to advance to third-straight AFL grand final
item.description: A training session on Saturday morning featuring speed work adds to Lachie Neale's optimism about returning for Brisbane in the AFL grand final after the Lions beat the Magpies.

item.title: Sharks and Knights reach NRLW preliminary finals
item.description: Cronulla keeps its season alive by defeating North Queensland, as Newcastle advances to a fourth NRLW preliminary final.

item.title: NRL finals updates: Cronulla Sharks defeat Canberra Raiders 32-12 in semifinal
item.description: An out-of-place nose doesn't hurt Joe Tapine as much as Canberra's NRL finals exit, but he hopes the pain of defeat will drive them to greater things next year.

item.title: Men's 4x400m relay team disqualified after national record, Mackenzie Little wins bronze at World Championships
item.description: The celebrations were cut short soon after the finish when the team were disqualified for a faulty changeover.

item.title: Brazilian race walker Ciao Bonfim loses wedding ring in race, wins maiden gold at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Brazilian race walker Ciao Bonfim won a gold medal in the 20km race walk, the first major global title of his career. But he lost something important on the way.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan qualifying: Oscar Piastri crashes out in Baku, Max Verstappen secures pole
item.description: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri crashed out of qualifying in Azerbaijan, but his teammate and championship rival Lando Norris was unable to make the Australian pay.

item.title: Republicans seize on Charlie Kirk's death to crack down on liberal dissent that puts freedom of speech 'in peril'
item.description: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

item.title: What is 'Solastalgia' and how are climate-affected communities tackling it?
item.description: If you're overwhelmed by emissions targets, climate change and environmental collapse, start small and look to First Nations practices to help your wellbeing and the world around you.

item.title: Asia's protests grew from social media where misinformation also spread
item.description: These movements may be separated by time, distance and language, but they were all born on social media, led by a new generation of activists fed up with the old systems of corruption and nepotism.

item.title: Antinatalists say human suffering, and climate change, makes having children unethical. Are they right?
item.description: Elon Musk believes the collapsing birth rate is humanity's biggest danger. But antinatalists argue having kids is little more than a procreational Ponzi scheme, and the risks are real.

item.title: What makes China confident enough to ban microchips made by US firm Nvidia?
item.description: Beijing's decision this week to ban Chinese companies from using microchips made by US firm Nvidia indicates the country is increasingly confident about replacing them with domestically produced chips, experts say.

item.title: Pirate attacks and sea robberies surge in key South-East Asian shipping lane
item.description: Piracy and sea robberies are increasing in the strategic straits of Malacca and Singapore, which could have implications for Australian imports and exports.

item.title: Cyber attack on Collins Aerospace disrupts check-in systems at major European airports
item.description: The attack on a provider of check-in and boarding systems causes mass disruption at several major European airports, including London's Heathrow.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will meet Donald Trump next week as Russia intensifies attacks
item.description: The Ukrainian president says he will hold "a meeting with the President of the United States" to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine and sanctions on Russia.

item.title: When is Jess Hull's 800m final? When do Nicola Olyslagers, Eleanor Patterson and Matt Denny compete?
item.description: Australia is looking at a veritable super Sunday on the final day of the 2025 World Athletics Championships, with four medals up for grabs. Here's when the Aussie contenders are in action.

item.title: Former nurse shares devastating experience of attempts to get urgent cancer surgery
item.description: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

item.title: Hard Quiz: So you think you're a trivia guru? Go on, prove it!
item.description: I like your trivia enthusiasm, but be careful — you're about to taste defeat.

item.title: The Duchess of Kent renounced her title in 2002 and never looked back
item.description: Away from the public eye, Katharine, the Duchess of Kent, was a trailblazer quietly changing lives.

item.title: When is Charlie Kirk's memorial service? How to watch it in Australia
item.description: A public memorial service will be held for the late political commentator at a stadium in the US state of Arizona.

item.title: Whale charity boss Brett Taylor allegedly ran euthanasia body 'discovery service'
item.description: Court documents allege a 53-year-old Queensland man ran a fake whale euthanasia charity to traffic assisted suicide drugs.

item.title: For Dr Mackenzie Little, javelin bronze at the World Athletics Championships is 'icing on the cake'
item.description: Mackenzie Little's second-successive World Athletics Championships bronze medal is an amazing achievement, all the more so considering she's a full-time surgical resident.

item.title: Widower kayaks through grief and love to raise money for cancer treatment
item.description: "Pensioner Pete" Dixon is paddling the 2,400-kilometre length of the Murray River with his poodle as a tribute to his late wife, raising money for cancer treatment in the process.

item.title: Scrubs is getting a reboot just in time for the hospital procedural revival
item.description: In a sea of hospital-based TV, long-running sitcoms Scrubs is often highlighted as one of the most realistic options. Now the reboot has been confirmed, and off the back of The Pitt’s big Emmy wins, we look back at the beloved show.

item.title: Chronic pain makes life hell for kids, but it's impacting work productivity as well
item.description: Chronic pain has devastating effects on those who suffer from it, including children, but it has wider impacts and they are costing Australia billions, a survey has found.

item.title: Jacinta Allan charts her own path with China in five-day tour of networking, photo ops and pandas
item.description: Premier Jacinta Allan has completed a tour of five Chinese cities where she has attempted to set the tone for future trade, boost Chinese international student numbers and promote her Suburban Rail Loop project.

item.title: Jay MacAskill and his daughters — Skylah and Ava — are building a strong bond over a new found love of skateboarding.

item.title: How skateboarding became a family affair for Townsville single dad Jay MacAskill
item.description: For almost eight years, Jay MacAskill's skateboard was collecting dust at home — until his daughter found the skate park around the corner.

item.title: Two weeks before Lisa's dream wedding in the Hawkesbury, her venue burnt down
item.description: Couples that were due to marry at the Loxley on Bellbird Hill wedding venue in the Hawkesbury feel they have been left in limbo following a devastating fire.

item.title: Canadian teenage golfer Anna Huang leads the La Sella Open by three shots after 54 holes
item.description: Canadian golf sensation Anna Huang, 16, is on the brink of making history, holding a three-shot lead going into the final round of a Ladies European Tour event in Spain.

item.title: Addressing Australia's housing crisis is a mammoth task. Is making housing a human right the answer?
item.description: The ACT government has passed legislation enshrining housing as a human right. What does that mean, and should other states follow?

item.title: Republicans warn Anthony Albanese of 'punitive measures' over Palestinian recognition
item.description: As Anthony Albanese touches down in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly, Republicans issue a warning against formally recognising Palestinian statehood.

item.title: Aspiring filmmakers learn from industry insiders
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Aspiring filmmakers gain hands-on experience with Bus Stop Films' Accessible Filmmaking Program
item.description: After 40 weeks developing their skills across various aspects of filmmaking, participants in the Accessible Filmmaking Program spent a day on set bringing their vision to life.

item.title: SA Liberals' star candidate in spotlight after AI algal bloom 'admin error'
item.description: When Frank Pangallo announced he was joining the Liberal party, he vowed to put the blowtorch on a first-term government riding high in the polls. But barely four weeks later, the blowtorch is firmly on Pangallo instead, writes Leah MacLennan.

item.title: Women celebrate vintage glam, self-love and healthy body image with pin-up
item.description: Women are embracing modern pin-up culture as a way to express confidence and joy in their own skin.

item.title: Baby dies after ute hits Jeep on the Pacific Motorway at Gaven on the Gold Coast
item.description: Police say initial investigations indicate a silver Jeep was parked on the side of the northbound M1, near the Smith Street on ramp, when it was struck by a grey utility.

item.title: The Adelaide Crows have been the powerhouse of the AFLW. Now they are being challenged
item.description: The AFLW's rapid evolution has been a double-edged sword for Adelaide, which is the most successful club in competition history, having won three of the eight premierships.

item.title: Man charged after police say they found $1 million in a cardboard box in his vehicle
item.description: Police say they were conducting a random breath test when they came across the cardboard box full of cash.

item.title: Man formally charged with murdering TikTok influencer Sana Yousaf in Pakistan
item.description: A Pakistani court charges a 22-year-old man with murder for shooting a teenage social media influencer, Sana Yousaf, after refusing his offer of friendship.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Climate change minister rules out mandating EV sales
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cockchafer worm wreaking havoc on West Australian grain crops
item.description: Growers and scientists have teamed up in a bid to combat the rapidly increasing population of the voracious pest, which is devastating crops in WA's south-east.

item.title: Government has not set 2035 renewables target, downplays 90 per cent
item.description: In New York for the UN summit, Energy Minister Chris Bowen declines to offer a renewable energy target for 2035 after the Climate Change Authority projected more than 90 per cent would be needed to hit its recommended emissions target.

item.title: Symbio Wildlife Park emu chicks being raised by hens after father walks out
item.description: Birds of a different feather are flocking together at a wildlife park in New South Wales, where the chickens have been given the responsibility of being foster parents to a pair of abandoned emu chicks.

item.title: Motoring enthusiasts take WWII jeeps on 2,000km journey
item.description: Most people embarking on a 2,000-kilometre road trip might opt for a vehicle with windows, not to mention air conditioning, power steering and an age of less than 80 years — but not this group of jeep super fans.

item.title: White House says the new $100k H-1B visa fee won't apply to existing holders
item.description: The massive fee hike prompted a panicked reaction from big tech companies, but the US government says workers already on the visa won't be affected.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland
item.description: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.
